What is the purpose of the OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag in Verus?

The OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY flag, with a value of 64, is used to restrict a PBaaS chain or gateway to a single currency. This means that when set, the chain or gateway will only support transactions in a single currency.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```
./raw_text_input_wiki/release_notes.md
What does the OPTION_GATEWAY flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY flag, with a value of 128, indicates that a chain or gateway is set up to route external currencies. This allows the gateway to handle transactions involving currencies from other chains.

a token, not a native currency

OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the significance of the OPTION_PBAAS flag in Verus?

The OPTION_PBAAS flag, with a value of 256, is used to define a PBaaS (Private Blockchain as a Service) chain. This flag is set when creating a PBaaS chain, which is a type of blockchain that allows for private, customizable blockchains to be created on top of the Verus network.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency
OPTION_GATEWAY = 128          // if set, this routes external currencies
OPTION_PBAAS = 256           // this is a PBaaS chain definition
OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What does the OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag do in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER flag, with a value of 512, indicates that a specific PBaaS gateway is set as the default converter and will publish prices. This means that the gateway will be responsible for converting between different currencies and publishing the conversion rates.
```

What is the purpose of the OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag in Verus?

The OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER flag, with a value of 1024, determines where top-level ID and currency registration happens. When this flag is not set on a gateway, registration happens on the launch chain. Otherwise, it happens on the gateway itself.

a token, not a native currency
OPTION_SINGLECURRENCY = 64       // for PBaaS chains or gateways to potentially restrict to single currency

OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain
OPTION_NFT_TOKEN = 2048        // single satoshi NFT token, tokenizes control over the root ID
```

What is the significance of the OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag in Verus?

The OPTION_NFT_TOKEN flag, with a value of 2048, is used to create a single satoshi NFT (Non-Fungible Token) that tokenizes control over the root ID. This means that the token represents ownership and control of a specific ID, and can be used to prove ownership and transfer control.

a token, not a native currency

OPTION_GATEWAY_CONVERTER = 512     // this means that for a specific PBaaS gateway, this is the default converter and will publish prices
OPTION_GATEWAY_NAMECONTROLLER = 1024  // when not set on a gateway, top level ID and currency registration happen on launch chain

```
